required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Brain and Renal Regional Oxygenation Using NIRS in Preterm Infants
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Brain and Renal Regional Oxygenation Using Near Infrared Spectroscopy (NIRS) Method in Very Low Birth Weight (<1500 g) Infants

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates the brain and renal oxygenation using near infrared spectroscopy in preterm infants with persistent ductus arteriosus

detailed_description.textblock:
Patent ductus arteriosus (PDA) is common in preterm infants. In the presence of a large PDA, significant systemic to pulmonary shunting occurs, which may result in pulmonary hyperperfusion and systemic hypoperfusion.
The evidence on PDA effect on brain and renal tissue oxygenation, measured by Near Infrared Spectroscopy is still controversial.
This study aims to evaluate the brain and renal oxygenation using near infrared spectroscopy (NONIN SenSmart model X-100) in 3 groups of preterm infants: 1) closed ductus arteriosus, 2) persistent ductus arteriosus, 3) hemodynamicaly significant ductus arteriosus.

primary_outcome.measure: Differences of the mean values of regional oxygenation of the brain and renal
primary_outcome.time_frame: from Day 4 of live up to 36 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Cerebral and renal regional tissue oxygen saturation monitoring on the day after echocardiography was done

arm_group.description: preterm infant with closed ductus arteriosus, <32 weeks birth weight < 1500g, and > 72 hours of age
preterm infant with PDA < 32 weeks, birth weight < 1500g, and > 72 hours of age
preterm infant with hemodynamically significant PDA < 32 weeks, birth weight < 1500g, and > 72 hours of age

intervention.intervention_name: NONIN SenSmart model X-100 near- infrared spectrometer
intervention.description: for to measure cerebral (cSO2) and renal (rSO2 ) regional tissue oxygen saturation on the day after echocardiography was done. The sensors were placed on the right/left forehead and the right/left lateral posterior flank

study_pop.textblock: Preterm infants with gestation age of < 32 weeks, birth weight < 1500g, > 72 hours of age, will have NIRS monitors placed to measure cerebral and renal regional tissue oxygenation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- preterm infants with gestation age of < 32 weeks
- birth weight < 1500g
- > 72 hours of age.
Exclusion Criteria:
- cardiovascular, renal, cerebral congenital defects,
- confirmed sepsis,
- no parental consent

facility.name: Vilnius University Santaros Klinikos Neonatology Center
